API for accessing Pull Requests from your Git/Github repositories.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Nicolas Pastorino <nicolas.pastorino at gmail dot com>

docblock.description: Get a listing of a project's pull requests by the username, repo, and optionally state.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the state of the fetched pull requests. The API seems to automatically default to 'open'

tag.name: return
tag.description: array of pull requests for the project

docblock.description: Show all details of a pull request, including the discussions.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the ID of the pull request for which details are retrieved

tag.name: return
tag.description: array of pull requests for the project

docblock.description: Create a pull request

tag.name: param
tag.description: A String of the branch or commit SHA that you want your changes to be pulled to.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A String of the branch or commit SHA of your changes. Typically this will be a branch. If the branch is in a fork of the original repository, specify the username first: "my-user:some-branch".

tag.name: param
tag.description: The String title of the Pull Request. Used in pair with $body.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The String body of the Pull Request. Used in pair with $title.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The issue number. Used when title and body is not set.

tag.name: return
tag.description: array of pull requests for the project
